section.title: sourceXmlLang and targetXmlLang
section.para: Language - the sourceXmlLang and targetXmlLang properties specify the source and target language variants of the text within a given object. For example: "sourceXmlLang" : "fr-FR" indicates the French language as spoken in France in the text nodes of the child source object.
Value description: A language code as described in [BCP 47].

listitem.para: For a "sourceXmlLang" property on an anonymous subunit object "kind" : "segment" object or an anonymous subunit object "kind" : "ignorable" object:
The value set on the "srcLang" property of the enclosing anonymous jliff object with property "files|subfiles|subgroups|subunits" object.
For a "targetXmlLang" property on an anonymous subunit object "kind" : "segment" object or an anonymous subunit object "kind" : "ignorable" object:
The value set on the "trgLang" property of the enclosing anonymous jliff object with property "files|subfiles|subgroups|subunits" object.

section.para: Used in: anonymous subunit object "kind" : "segment" or anonymous subunit object "kind" : "ignorable" objects.
